series.title: Safe in His Hands — The Promise of Salvation

lesson.title: Knowing That You Are Saved
lesson.summary: Believe and be saved now: forgiven, freed, washed, justified, reconciled; born of God; passed from death to life.

points.point: Salvation is immediate when we believe and confess Jesus.
God forgives, frees, washes, justifies, reconciles the believer.
We are begotten of God and have eternal life; we can know we are saved.

lesson.practice: “Jesus, I believe. Thank You — I am Yours.”

lesson.title: By the Word of God
lesson.summary: Assurance rests on God’s written Word, the Spirit’s inner witness, and our love for the brothers.

points.point: God’s Word is sure; those who believe have eternal life.
The Spirit witnesses with our spirit — “Abba, Father.”
Love for believers shows we passed from death to life.

lesson.practice: Read 1 John 5:13; insert your name; thank God for certainty.

lesson.title: The Security of Salvation
lesson.summary: Our salvation is secure because God is unchanging, His love inseparable, His calling irrevocable, and His hand almighty.

points.point: Invariable God; unchanging will and calling.
No one can snatch us from the Father’s hand.

lesson.practice: “Father, thank You — I am safe in Your hands.”

lesson.title: By God’s Eternal Life
lesson.summary: Eternal life, God’s new covenant, Christ’s perfect redemption, and His unfailing promise secure us forever.

points.point: Jesus gives eternal life; we shall not perish.
New covenant guarantees forgiveness and God’s law in our hearts.
Christ’s redemption is complete and eternal; His promise stands.

lesson.title: The Need of Your Whole Family to Be Saved
lesson.summary: God often saves by households; pursue the salvation of your whole family and even your neighbors.

points.point: Unit of salvation is the household — “salvation has come to this house.”
Old Testament patterns: Noah, Passover, Rahab.
Lead your family to receive Jesus.

lesson.practice: List 3 family members and pray for their salvation.

lesson.title: In the New Testament
lesson.summary: New Testament cases show households believing together; the issue is families serving the Lord.

points.point: Examples: Zaccheus; Cornelius; Lydia; Philippian jailer.
“As for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.”

lesson.practice: Choose one family way to serve the Lord this week.
